revised_title: John Boyd Orr: A Life of Service and Advocacy for Social and Economic Justice
tldr: John Boyd Orr was a Scottish biologist and statesman who dedicated his life to improving the living conditions of the poor and advocating for social and economic justice. He was born into a religious and intellectually stimulating family and received a classical education. After teaching in slums and witnessing the suffering of the poor, he became a passionate advocate for social reform. Orr worked to improve education and nutrition, and he played a significant role in the establishment of the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization. His life's work focused on alleviating poverty, hunger, and squalor, and he remains a prominent figure in the fight for social justice.
